input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

At home, we were busy preparing for a family painting night, with plenty of planning and preparation to ensure a colorful and expressive evening for all. The kids were excited about the prospect of creating their own masterpieces and spending time with their family, and we all looked forward to a night of connection and self-expression.

 Week 51 (December 16th - December 22nd):
The fifty-first week of the year was a week of connection and community, as we took time to connect with our friends and neighbors and build stronger relationships. I spent some time organizing a community event and inviting our neighbors to join us. At home, we were busy preparing for a family holiday party, with plenty of planning and preparation to ensure a festive and enjoyable evening for all. The kids were thrilled about the prospect of decorating the house and preparing holiday treats, and we all looked forward to a night of connection and celebration.

 Week 52 (December 23rd - December 31st):
The fifty-second week of the year was a week of reflection and gratitude, as we took time to reflect on the past year and express our gratitude for the people and experiences that have enriched our lives. I spent some time writing in my journal and reflecting on my personal growth. At home, we were busy preparing for a family New Year's Eve party, with plenty of planning and preparation to ensure a memorable and joyful evening for all. The kids were excited about the prospect of ringing in the new year and spending time with their loved ones, and we all looked forward to a night of connection and hope for the future.

 End of the Year
As the year comes to a close, I take a moment to reflect on the past 12 months and all that I have accomplished. I am grateful for the opportunities I have had to learn and grow, both personally and professionally. I am grateful for the people in my life who have supported and encouraged me, and for the experiences that have brought me joy and fulfillment. I look forward to the new year and all the possibilities it holds, and I am excited to continue exploring the world of design and architecture.

 Happy New Year!
As we enter a new year, I am filled with hope and optimism for the future. I am excited to continue learning and growing, both personally and professionally. I am grateful for the people in my life who have supported and encouraged me, and for the opportunities that lie ahead. I wish you all a happy and prosperous new year, filled with love, joy, and creativity. Let us make the most of this new beginning and embrace the possibilities that await us.

 End of the Diary
This concludes my weekly diary for the year 2023. I hope you have enjoyed reading about my experiences and reflections. I look forward to continuing to share my journey with you in the coming year. Until next time, take care and stay creative!

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 51 for graphic design studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 55 for music school use.
  - Designate Floor 7 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 19 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 74 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for yoga studio use.
  - Designate Floor 10 for daycare center use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for photography studio use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 33 for a hospital with various departments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.

  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. The red wine pairs beautifully with the rich, savory dishes, while the white wine adds a refreshing contrast to the indulgent desserts.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new year and the start of a year filled with gourmet experiences.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and comforting, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread topped with melted cheese. The rich, savory flavors of the onions are beautifully balanced by the savory broth and the melted cheese adds a delightful texture.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. The dip is served with warm pita bread, making it a perfect starter for a cozy winter meal.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French stew made with tender beef, red wine, onions, garlic, and mushrooms. The rich, savory flavors of the beef and wine are beautifully complemented by the earthy flavors of the mushrooms and onions.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting, hearty dish made with tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust, making it a perfect dish for a cozy winter evening.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy, sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of butter and a hint of cinnamon. The subtle sweetness of the potatoes is beautifully balanced by the savory flavors of the main courses.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with garlic and almonds. The crispy almonds add a delightful crunch to the tender green beans, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich, savory main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, tart flavors of the apples are beautifully balanced by the crispy, nutty topping and the creamy ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake made with the finest cocoa and topped with a silky chocolate ganache. The intense chocolate flavor is sure to satisfy even the most discerning sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine that pairs beautifully with the rich, savory flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with the finest cocoa and topped with whipped cream. The perfect dessert drink to warm up on a chilly winter evening.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both flavorful and healthy, perfect for those looking to start the new year off on the right foot.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. The fresh, juicy tomatoes are beautifully complemented by the creamy mozzarella and the aromatic basil, while the balsamic glaze adds a delightful tang.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans served with a touch of sea salt. The tender, slightly sweet soybeans are a delicious and healthy snack, perfect for those looking for a light, flavorful appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: A flavorful, healthy main course made with fresh salmon, seasoned with a blend of herbs and spices and grilled to perfection. The tender, juicy salmon is served with a side of quinoa and steamed vegetables, making it a perfect dish for those looking to eat well.
2.2) Quinoa Bowl: A hearty, healthy bowl made with cooked quinoa, roasted vegetables, and a drizzle of tahini dressing. The nutty, slightly sweet flavor of the quinoa is beautifully complemented by the roasted vegetables and the tangy, savory tahini dressing.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Tender Brussels sprouts roasted until they are caramelized and crispy on the outside, yet still tender on the inside. The savory, slightly sweet flavor of the sprouts is a perfect accompaniment to the flavorful main courses.
3.2) Brown Rice: A healthy, flavorful side dish made with cooked brown rice. The nutty, slightly sweet flavor of the rice is a perfect accompaniment to the savory, flavorful main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fresh Fruit Salad: A refreshing, healthy dessert made with a selection of fresh fruits, dressed with a tangy citrus dressing. The sweet, juicy flavors of the fruits are a perfect way to end a healthy, flavorful meal.
4.2) Dark Chocolate Mousse: A rich, decadent dessert made with dark chocolate and whipped cream. The intense, velvety flavor of the chocolate is beautifully balanced by the light, airy texture of the mousse, making it a perfect indulgence for those with a sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Green Tea: A refreshing, healthy drink made with hot water and a tea bag of your choice. The subtle, slightly sweet flavor of the tea is a perfect accompaniment to the healthy, flavorful dishes.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, zero-calorie drink that is perfect for those looking to hydrate without adding any extra calories to their meal.
 Menu for Week 4:
This week's menu features a selection of dishes inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Hummus: A classic Mediterranean dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice. The smooth, creamy texture and the savory, slightly nutty flavor of the hummus make it a perfect starter for a Mediterranean-inspired meal.
1.2) Olives: A selection of marinated olives, served with crusty bread and a glass of wine. The briny, savory flavor of the olives is beautifully complemented by the crispy, crusty bread and the rich, full-bodied wine.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A traditional Spanish dish made with saffron-infused rice, chicken, shrimp, mussels, and peas. The savory, slightly sweet flavor of the rice is beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy chicken and the succulent, briny seafood.
2.2) Lamb Kebabs: Tender lamb skewers marinated in a blend of herbs and spices, grilled to perfection and served with a side of pita bread and a tangy yogurt sauce. The rich, savory flavor of the lamb is beautifully complemented by the aromatic herbs and spices, while the tangy yogurt sauce adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Vegetables: A selection of seasonal vegetables grilled to perfection and served with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of sea salt. The smoky, slightly charred flavor of the vegetables is a perfect accompaniment to the rich, savory main courses.
3.2) Greek Salad: A classic Mediterranean salad made with fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, feta cheese, and a tangy vinaigrette. The fresh, crisp flavors of the salad are a perfect complement to the rich, savory main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich, sweet dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, chopped nuts, and honey syrup. The crispy, flaky texture of the phyllo dough is beautifully complemented by the sweet, nutty filling and the sticky, syrupy topping.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A traditional Turkish dessert made with a gel-like consistency, flavored with rosewater or other aromatic flavors. The delicate, sweet flavor of the Turkish delight is a perfect indulgence for those with a sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sangria: A refreshing, fruity drink made with red wine, fruit, and a splash of brandy. The sweet, fruity flavors of the sangria are a perfect complement to the rich, savory flavors of the Mediterranean-inspired dishes.
5.2) Ouzo: A traditional Greek anise-flavored liqueur, served as a digestif after the meal. The licorice-like flavor of the ouzo is a perfect way to round out a Mediterranean-inspired meal.
$# Menu for Week 5:
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Asia.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy, golden-brown rolls filled with a savory mixture of vegetables and meat, served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. The crispy texture of the rolls is beautifully contrasted by the tender, flavorful filling, while the sweet and sour dipping sauce adds a delightful tang.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans served with a touch of sea salt. The tender, slightly sweet flavor of the edamame is a perfect starter for an Asian-inspired meal.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Teriyaki Chicken: Juicy, tender chicken marinated in a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce and grilled to perfection. The rich, savory flavor of the teriyaki sauce is beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy chicken, making for a delicious and satisfying main course.
2.2) Pad Thai: Stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp, bean sprouts, scallions, and a tangy peanut sauce. The savory, slightly sweet flavor of the peanut sauce is beautifully complemented by the tender, succulent shrimp and the crisp texture of the bean sprouts, making for a delicious and satisfying main course.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: Savory rice stir-fried with vegetables and scrambled eggs. The savory, slightly sweet flavor of the rice is beautifully complemented by the tender, crisp vegetables and the savory, slightly runny eggs.
3.2) Steamed Bok Choy: Tender, slightly sweet bok choy steamed to perfection and served with a touch of soy sauce. The delicate, slightly sweet flavor of the bok choy is beautifully complemented by the savory, umami-rich soy sauce, making for a delicious and healthy side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mochi: Soft, chewy rice cakes filled with a sweet, creamy filling. The chewy texture of the mochi is beautifully contrasted by the creamy, sweet filling, making for a delicious and satisfying dessert.
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: Creamy, rich ice cream infused with the subtle, slightly bitter flavor of green tea. The delicate, slightly bitter flavor of the green tea is beautifully complemented by the creamy, rich texture of the ice cream, making for a delicious and refreshing dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: Traditional Japanese rice wine, served chilled or warmed. The subtle, slightly sweet flavor of the sake is beautifully complemented by the rich, savory flavors of the Asian-inspired dishes.
5.2) Plum Wine: Sweet, fruity wine infused with the flavor of ripe plums. The sweet, fruity flavor of the plum wine is a perfect complement to the delicate, slightly sweet flavors of the Asian-inspired desserts.
%# Week 6 Menu:
1. Starters:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the tomatoes and basil are beautifully complemented by the crispy texture of the toasted bread, making for a delicious and satisfying starter.
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze. The sweet, juicy flavors of the tomatoes and mozzarella are beautifully complemented by the aromatic, slightly peppery flavor of the basil and the tangy, slightly sweet balsamic glaze, making for a delicious and refreshing starter.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Ribeye Steak: Juicy, tender ribeye steak seasoned with salt and pepper and grilled to perfection. The rich, savory flavor of the steak is beautifully complemented by the crispy texture of the grill marks and the tender, juicy texture of the meat, making for a delicious and satisfying main course.
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the marinara sauce and melted mozzarella are beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy texture of the chicken, making for a delicious and satisfying main course.
3. Sides:
3.1) Roasted Vegetables: Tender, slightly caramelized vegetables roasted to perfection and seasoned with herbs and spices. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the vegetables are beautifully complemented by the crispy texture of the roasted edges and the aromatic, slightly herbal flavors of the herbs and spices, making for a delicious and healthy side dish.
3.2) Mashed Potatoes: Creamy, smooth mashed potatoes seasoned with butter and milk. The rich, savory flavor of the potatoes is beautifully complemented by the creamy texture and the slight sweetness of the butter and milk, making for a delicious and comforting side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Cake: Rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a silky, chocolate ganache. The intense, rich flavor of the chocolate is beautifully complemented by the velvety texture of the ganache and the moist, tender texture of the cake, making for a delicious and indulgent dessert.
4.2) Apple Crisp: Warm, sweet apples topped with a crispy, buttery oatmeal topping. The sweet, tart flavors of the apples are beautifully complemented by the crispy, buttery texture of the topping and the warm, comforting texture of the apples, making for a delicious and comforting dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Merlot: Rich, full-bodied red wine with notes of dark fruit and chocolate. The bold, savory flavors of the merlot are beautifully complemented by the rich, savory flavors of the main courses, making for a delicious and satisfying pairing.
5.2) Champagne: Crisp, bubbly champagne with a delicate, fruity flavor. The light, refreshing flavor of the champagne is beautifully complemented by the sweet, decadent flavors of the desserts, making for a delicious and celebratory pairing.
&* Menu for Week 7:
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Calamari: Crispy, golden-brown fried calamari served with a tangy marinara sauce. The tender, slightly chewy texture of the calamari is beautifully complemented by the crispy, golden-brown exterior and the tangy, slightly sweet flavor of the marinara sauce, making for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. The sweet, juicy flavors of the tomatoes are beautifully complemented by the aromatic, slightly peppery flavor of the basil and the tangy, slightly sweet flavor of the balsamic glaze, making for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Juicy, tender salmon fillets seasoned with herbs and spices and grilled to perfection. The rich, slightly sweet flavor of the salmon is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly smoky flavor of the grill and the tender, juicy texture of the fish, making for a delicious and healthy main course.
2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Tender, slow-cooked beef in a rich, savory red wine sauce with carrots, onions, and mushrooms. The rich, savory flavor of the beef is beautifully complemented by the slightly sweet, tangy flavor of the red wine sauce and the tender, slightly sweet flavors of the carrots, onions, and mushrooms, making for a delicious and satisfying main course.
3. Sides:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy, smooth mashed potatoes seasoned with garlic and butter. The rich, savory flavor of the garlic is beautifully complemented by the creamy, smooth texture of the potatoes and the slight sweetness of the butter, making for a delicious and comforting side dish.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy-tender green beans sautéed with almonds and browned butter. The slightly sweet, nutty flavor of the almonds is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly sweet flavor of the browned butter and the crispy-tender texture of the green beans, making for a delicious and healthy side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: Rich, creamy custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. The velvety, slightly sweet flavor of the custard is beautifully complemented by the crispy, caramelized texture of the sugar crust and the slight bitterness of the burnt sugar, making for a delicious and indulgent dessert.
4.2) Lemon Tart: Tangy, tart lemon curd in a crispy, buttery pastry shell. The tangy, slightly sweet flavor of the lemon curd is beautifully complemented by the crispy, buttery texture of the pastry shell and the slight sweetness of the pastry cream, making for a delicious and refreshing dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Cabernet Sauvignon: Full-bodied red wine with notes of dark fruit and a hint of oak. The bold, savory flavors of the cabernet sauvignon are beautifully complemented by the rich, savory flavors of the main courses, making for a delicious and satisfying pairing.
5.2) Champagne: Crisp, bubbly champagne with a fruity, slightly sweet flavor. The light, refreshing flavor of the champagne is beautifully complemented by the rich, indulgent flavors of the desserts, making for a delicious and celebratory pairing.
# Menu for Week 8:
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: Creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. The rich, savory flavors of the spinach and artichokes are beautifully complemented by the creamy texture of the cheese dip and the slight crunch of the tortilla chips, making for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The sweet, juicy flavors of the tomatoes are beautifully complemented by the aromatic, slightly peppery flavor of the basil and the savory, slightly toasted texture of the bread, making for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese. As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.

5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new year.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that warm the soul and nourish the body.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.

2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A hearty stew made with tender beef, red wine, and a variety of vegetables.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of brown sugar and a splash of milk.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and a crunchy topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich and nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.

5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):

 Menu Week 5 (February 5th - February 11th): Squash and Pumpkin Delights

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.

Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 8) for school use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 3) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 2) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (5, 0) for residential area use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the column from (2, 8) to (3, 8).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a small park starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
